robot_capabilities.drone: Can fly and scan large areas quickly. Equipped with thermal camera, lidar, GPS, and standard camera. Suitable for fire detection, aerial surveillance, and locating hotspots. Cannot interact physically but provides crucial overview and alerts.
robot_capabilities.robot_dog_with_arm: Capable of navigating rough, hazardous terrain. It can go to a place where the fire has been set. Equipped with robotic arm, thermal and depth camera, lidar, and GPS. Can open doors, carry small fire extinguishers, and assist in basic rescue or hazard removal tasks.
robot_capabilities.differential_drive_robot_with_arm: Can move on flat or moderately rough surfaces. It can spray water. Equipped with robotic arm, thermal camera, lidar, GPS, and water spray tool. Can suppress small fires, remove objects, or deliver fire-fighting tools on-site.

robot_morphology.drone: Payload: ~3 kg, Speed: 0–6 m/s, Weight: 10 kg, Size: 600 x 300 x 200 mm, Flight Endurance: ~20 min, Sensor Range: ~50 m
robot_morphology.robot_dog_with_arm: Payload: ~8 kg, Speed: 0–3 m/s, Weight: 42 kg, Size: 1000 x 500 x 500 mm, Arm Reach: ~0.6 m, Terrain: rubble, indoor stairs, ramps
robot_morphology.differential_drive_robot_with_arm: Payload: ~10 kg, Speed: 0–1.8 m/s, Weight: 48 kg, Size: 850 x 500 x 550 mm, Arm Reach: ~0.8 m

task_specific_rules: TO protect someone inside a fire-affected building, the robot dog should go inside the building first, then search for the human, then lead him to outside via safe path.
task_replanning_rules: If a robot is blocked by fire or debris, reroute or pause and call for assistance.
If drone battery is low mid-mission, return for recharge and alert ground units.
If no robot can reach the flame directly, notify human operator for intervention.
